info.description:
**WORK IN PROGRESS! **

This is a working document, an informal draft for API "note-taking", evaluation of API-related tools, etc. Contains several errors, contradictions and mistakes. Some Wikipedia texts added as placeholders/examples.

HTTP response codes

* Wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_HTTP_status_codes
* W3C: https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec10.html


| HTTP method | Success  | Fail  |
| -------- | -------- | -------- |
| GET     | 200     | 404, 4XX, 5XX     |
| POST     | 200, 201     | 400, 404, 4XX, 5XX     |
| PUT | 204 | 400, 404, 4XX, 5XX |
info.title: API AWS

get.description: Simplified example. Requires a method of identification, the minimum being Facebook or Google OAuth.
For now: Also returns some housekeeping details, as an example.

balance.description: Some details of current balance, if relevant to the subscription plan

get.description: How am I doing? Am I near my limit?

All details of current API user account:
* Contact details
* API key details
* Payment/plan/subscription
* Throttling info
* etc

200.description: Details of current API key holder.

404.description: Server up, but not for you.

get.description: Nice if this is different from /customers/{customerId}.
Customer score with all details.
Maybe add query parameters for filtering? '?type=stocks', etc

post.description: Maybe send partial Account object (without account number) in request?

delete.description: Maybe return HTTP 2XX 'marked for deletion', as the account will not be deleted immediately?

500.description: I'm afraid I can't do that.

417.description: Expectation Failed: Requires prior (paranormal) transfer of customer's expectation (haha).

get.description: The current balance, minus known outgoing transactions, plus known incoming transactions.

200.description: Here it is! Don't spend it all at once.

401.description: Hmmm, not really your account, is it?

get.description: Account statement for specified account, year and month. Some meta data, and a list of all transactions.
Supports pagination: pagesize and pagenumber,

get.summary: List of transactions for one month

get.description: Need to provide more than an Account object, but then again this is a draft/note only.

post.description:
For now: Using Account object with SSIDs of tennant and owner. 

Required:
* Electronic copy of signed rental agreement
* The address of the apartment (or license details for car, boat, etc)
* Name, SSN, email, phone of the lender (or is SSN sufficient, at least for existing DNB customers?)

Use a Customer object?

DNB deposit account: https://www.dnb.no/privat/nettbank-mobil-og-kort/konto/depositumskonto.html

parameters.name: ownerid
parameters.description: Personal id number (SSN) of the "owner" for the artifact this deposit account is security for, 11 digits.

parameters.name: lenderid
parameters.description: Personal id number (SSN) of the "lender" for the artifact this deposit account is security for, 11 digits.

post.description: TBD. Needs a lot more details. Just a note, really.

get.summary: Get transactions with code MCC for one account

post.description: Need to POST quite a bit of data, and also handle AML, KYC, etc

get.description: For now: Returns a Loan object.

get.summary: Check if the person has approval
get.description: Optional parameters: County (kommunenummer), gnr (gårdsnummer) and bnr (bruksnummer ) may be used to specify which property the preapproval is being checked for. This may allow DNB to find out that the preapproval holder is in a bidding process.

404.description: This person does not have financing for the specified amount.

429.description: To prevent repeated attempts at guessing the "desiredamount".

post.description: For now apply for a specified amount only. If the amouhnt specified is 0 (zero), the application will be treated as for the maximum possible amount.

delete.description:
When a loan is issued, either by DNB or another bank, the preapproval should be deleted.
Separate method to avoid specifying amount. "Personnr" is sufficient.

get.summary: Get a list rates for the most common currencies, with a specified base
get.description:
Suitable for making a table or similar.

```
{
    disclaimer: "http://api.dnb.no/diclaimer_goes_here/",
    license: "http://api.dnb.no/license_goes_here/",
    timestamp: 1504548341,
    base: "NOK",
    rates: {
        AED: 3.672538,
        AFN: 66.809999,
        ALL: 125.716501,
        AMD: 484.902502,
        ANG: 1.788575,
        AOA: 135.295998,
        ARS: 9.750101,
        AUD: 1.390866,
        /* ... */
    }
}
```

parameters.name: base
parameters.description: "Home" currency. ISO 4217: alpha 3-letter upcase e.g EUR

get.summary: Convert amount from CUR1 to CUR2

post.description: Refers to object "Insuranceclaim", which is a very simplified representation.

200.description: Claim received (not approved quite yet, though).

get.summary: Get info about a car's insurance
get.description: Check if a car is insured: /insurance/car/AB12345

post.description:
Needs a lot of input. https://www.dnb.no/privat/forsikring/bilforsikring.html

For now: Assume the attributes of Car object are sufficient.

get.description: For now: Return a list of Locations. Later: Array of object representing car towing services.

Based on the specified location: List the nearest car service Locations, sorted by distance. Ideally: Also provide references to details about each service Location (contact info, opening hours, etc).

get.summary: Check if there is a weather alert

200.description: Yes there is, and here are the details.

get.description: If no details (as for now): Assume ATM is open 24h.
For now: Assume geocoding functionality similar to Google Maps: https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/geocoding/intro

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: For now: Assume geocoding functionality similar to Google Maps: https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/geocoding/intro

get.description: Response may not be ideal - input is welcome. Google Places' ```opening_hours```may be useful: https://developers.google.com/places/web-service/details

day.description: Monday: 1, Tuesday: 2, Wednesday: 3, Thursday: 4, Friday: 5, Saturday: 6, Sunday: 7

get.description: Returns an array of strings, which may include all kinds of iformation (text, URLs, media, etc).

get.summary: Get info about stock with ticker
get.description: Key information, such as: Company name, organization number, contact information, etc.
For now: Returns a number.

200.description: Maybe just a Person, as he/she may not be a customer with us.

post.description: Should POST a Person, not Customer

200.description: Created, status, name, owners/admins, list of expenses

post.description: Phone number, personal id number, name, card number, account number

get.summary: Liquidity status for year, month and company.
Liquidity prognosis for year, month and copmpany.
Liquidity for year, month and company.

parameters.name: ?type=
parameters.description: What to compare: revenue, profitability, liquidity

parameters.name: customerIdCompare
parameters.description: Organization number of company to to compare with, 9 digits. Example: 123456789

get.summary: Annual report for year and company,
Get SAF-T file for a company of type

post.summary: Send new SAF-T file of type

get.summary: Get SAF-T file for a company

Id.description:
Person: Personal number, 11 digits.
Company: Organization number, 9 digits.

Customer.description:
Draft, needs update from actual properties below.

Also doubles as "Person", i.e: Not all Customer objects are DNB customers. A Customer is to be seen as a human person with certain attributes.

```
{
	"id": "17066099999",
	“email”: "rune.bjerke@dnb.no", 
	“first_name”: “Rune”, 
	“last_name”: “Bjerke”, 
	“gender”: “m”, 
	“adr_street”: “Dronning Eufemias gate 30”, 
	“adr_post_code”: “0191”,
	"adr_city”: “Oslo”, 
	“adr_country”: “NO”, 
	“phone": “+47 04800”, 
	“birthday”: “1960-06-17”, 
	“created”: “2015-07-01T10:42:00+01:00”, 
	“updated”: “2015-10-01T10:42:00+01:00”,
}
```

number.description: 11 digits. Bank, etc can be determined from this: https://no.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kontonummer

Account.description:
For now: One kind of Account for all.

```
{
		"number": "05000000000",
		"type": "1",
		"name": "Gordon Gecko's savings account",
		"currency": "NOK",
		"balance": 999999999,
		"IBAN": "NO93 8601 1117 947",
		"SWIFT": "DNBANOKKXXX",
		"created": "2010-07-01T10:42:00+01:00",
		"updated": "2015-07-01T10:42:00+01:00",
		"locked": 0,
		"notes": "No lunch for you"
}
```

expires.description: Remaining time can be calculated from this.

Loan.description: For now: One common loan type for mortgage, car, credit card, etc

type.description: To indicate: Car, house, travel, etc

name.description: DNB's name for this type of insurance. "DNB Bolig Best", etc.

tc.description: URL (or other reference) to Terms & Conditions for this insurance.

Insurance.description: For now: One common Insurance object for all types (house, car, health, etc).

details.description: Details for this insurance offer: Date issued, valid until, etc.

Insuranceoffer.description: For now: A simple object to represent an insurance offer. Refers to Insurance for simplicity.

Insuranceclaim.description: For now: A simple object to represent an insurance claim. Should include all details necessary to make a claim.

milage.description: In kilometers. No date specified for now.

description.description: Make, model, etc. This can be fetched from Statens Vegvesen (perhaps no API, just a web page? https://www.vegvesen.no/Kjoretoy/Kjop+og+salg/Kj%C3%B8ret%C3%B8yopplysninger)

merchantSerialNumber.description: Identifies a merchant sales channel i.e. website, mobile app etc.

callBack.description: ViPPS will use this Call back URL to provide the status of initiated transaction. Length of the string is 255 characters

mobileNumber.description:
Mobile number of the user who has to pay for the  transaction from ViPPS.
Allowed format:
+47-xxxxxxxx
+47xxxxxxxx
xxxxxxxx

orderId.description: Id which uniquely identifies an Order. Maximum length is 30 alphanumeric characters

refOrderId.description: Identifies if the payment references to some past orders registered with ViPPS. If defined, transactions for this payment will show up as child transactions of the specified order. Described functionality is not in place and is planned for future implementation

transactionText.description: Transaction text that can be displayed to end user

timeStamp.description:
Timestamp in ISO
-
8601 representing when the 
order has been made by merchant

VippsPaymentResponse.description:
From 8.3.7: https://www.vipps.no/portalfront/vipps/nedlast/eCommerce_API_v1.2.pdf

```
{
    "orderId": "219930212",
    "merchantSerialNumber": "NSBWSHP12",
    "transactionInfo": {
        "amount": 1200,
        "status": "Initiate",
        "transactionId": "1001234566",
        "timeStamp": "2014-06-24T08:34:25-07:00" , 
        "message":"Please use vipps app to process the payment"
    }
}
```

fileurl.description: (Unless all data is included in Object)

SAFTfile.description:
Standard Audit File - Tax

Example file: https://github.com/Skatteetaten/saf-t/blob/master/Example%20Files/ExampleFile%20SAF-T%20Financial_999999999_20161125213512.xml
